revised_title: Exploring Bijugate Apices in Dipsacus Laciniatus
tldr: The author investigates the bijugate phyllotaxis in Dipsacus laciniatus, a type of plant with paired leaves that do not form a right angle. They conduct experiments by removing specific leaf pairs and observe the changes in leaf angles. The results challenge the inhibition hypothesis and suggest that the bijugate arrangement is due to a combination of factors, including leaf base shapes and pressure exerted by the upstanding parts of the second youngest leaf pair on the stem apex.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
